edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2

Class House

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Character
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.House

  • public class House
extends Character
    Author:
    David Scianni. The House class represents the character the Player is trying to beat. This class will have no control from the user, but will be controlled by the main method in Game.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Character

        currentCardCount, hand

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      House()
      The House constructor calls the Character constructor and sends 5000, which represents how much Character.money the house starts the game with, $5000.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void printFirstHand()
      The printFirstHand method is used to hide the second card in House's hand during the Player's turn, so that the Player cannot see what the House's score is.
      void printHand()
      This abstract method will print out the Character's Character.hand depending on which subclass calls it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • House

        public House()
        The House constructor calls the Character constructor and sends 5000, which represents how much Character.money the house starts the game with, $5000.

    • Method Detail

      • printHand

        public void printHand()
        Description copied from class: Character
        This abstract method will print out the Character's Character.hand depending on which subclass calls it. If the Player class calls this method, it will print out each card in its hand in a graphical way, i.e. |Ad| |Kh|. If the House class calls the method, it will print the same as Player, but will also display the current amount of Character.money that the house has in its pot. Both classes will check to see how many cards are in their hand, and will display that many cards on the screen.
        Specified by:
        printHand in class Character

      • printFirstHand

        public void printFirstHand()
        The printFirstHand method is used to hide the second card in House's hand during the Player's turn, so that the Player cannot see what the House's score is. It prints the first card but leaves the second card blank, and it shows how much Character.money the House still has.
